features.feature: Calculate Total Billable Amount for Member Record Including Projected Due
features.source_document: GRC_Billing/Billing/Billing Implementation Requirements/Common Billing Requirements/Billing Rules/BR_Balances/BR_Calculate Total Billable Amount for selected Member Record.md
features.evidence: Identify all the invoices corresponding to full invoicing periods between Member Record Effective Date and provided 'Date' on all the Billing Accounts where the provided Member Record was ever billed by the selected 'Date'. Calculate Total Due for the Member Record according to the following formula: Total Due = Total Billed (sum of Total Billed from all the invoices identified on Step#1) - Issued Write Offs and Balance Adjustments (as of 'Date') - Negative Adjustments that are used to pay invoice (as of 'Date'). If provided 'Date' is not equal to the Invoicing Period End Date of the last invoice, calculate Projected Due Amount for the Member Record according to the formula: Projected Due Amount = DR x number days between Date and Invoicing Period End Date of the last invoice, rounded to two digits after decimal by using rounding strategy HALF_UP. Calculate Total Billable Amount for the Member Record: Total Billable Amount = Total Paid + MR Overpayment (as of 'Date') - Total Due - Projected Due Amount.

features.feature: Calculate Product-Level Balances Using Balance Register Operations
features.source_document: GRC_Billing/Billing/Billing Implementation Requirements/Common Billing Requirements/Billing Rules/BR_Balances/BR_Calculate Product Balances.md
features.evidence: The balances described below are calculated on the level of Billing Product Item (InvoiceBalanceDetails.balances) and on the level of Invoice (Invoice.balances). TOTAL_BILLED: The total billed amount of product - the sum of amounts of all invoiced items of product item. TOTAL_PAID: The total amount paid for the product - the sum of incoming and outgoing money from product addition to the billing account till current moment. REMAINING_DUE: The remaining amount to be paid for the product (can be negative in case of overpayment). Balances for Billing Product Item are calculated using the Balance Register Operations created for them. Calculations should occur by Amount type (in order to have the breakdown) and then should be summed to get the total amount. Total Billed: SUM(WRITTEN_BILLABLE, BILLED) - SUM(BILLED, WRITTEN_BILLABLE). Total Paid: SUM(CASH, PAID) - SUM(PAID, CASH). Remaining Due: RemainingDue = TotalBilled - TotalPaid - SBWO.

features.feature: Manage Dynamic Balance Calculation with Caching and Real-Time Updates
features.source_document: GRC_Billing/Billing/Billing Implementation Requirements/Common Billing Requirements/Billing Balances Calculation.md
features.evidence: The business goal of displaying billing balances is to show the current state of the billing account or member record in numbers. Billing balances are dynamic. Billing balances change after each billing transaction (such as invoice generation/discard, payment, refund, transfer, write-off, etc.) This is in contrast to invoice balances which are calculated at the moment of invoice generation and stay unchanged thereafter. There are several ways to calculate billing balances technically. One potential way is to calculate them by means of Billing Balance Register subdomain. Another way is based on transactions. A third way is to take most recent invoice balances as a baseline and to add transactions that occurred after the invoice generation. From a business perspective, all these ways should produce the same result.
